intro: Gonolobus albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower go-nolobus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in soil enrichment through its nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
